comment: She maybe be boring at first, but her assigned plays to watch didn't even feel like assignments; I genuinely enjoyed myself. And the group project made the course a lot more interesting. Who knew making a play with a group was so much fun!?
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I had Jodye for my fall 2023 semester, and she was an absolute delight! It was my first semester in college, and not only did she help students with the course material, but she also was a great guide to new students. We had super interactive lectures, played some theatre games, read and discussed some important plays, and more. Would 100% rec. :)
Very easy class. There is very minimal work. The final is a presentation before finals week. She is such a sweetheart!

Professor Underwood is an amazing professor. She is super sweet, approachable, and accommodating. Even if you don't like theater, her enthusiasm and passion for what she is teaching will help keep you engaged. There are not many assignments and she is a super easy grader. Overall she was great, I would definitely recommend her.
She is very sweet and is very passionate about what she teaches which makes what could be a boring class much more interesting.
I loved her theatre in society class even though I dislike theater. Her assignments are straight forward and she's an easy grader. She is very kind and easy to talk to, definitely recommend!

Jodye is a great professor and her class is super easy! There's lots of opportunities for extra credit, but you won't even need it because the work she assigns is super easy! She's also really fun and laidback and super nice!

This professor is so so sweet and very understanding of all of her students. The tests are very easy and mostly common sense. The final is also just group work and shes gives you a lot of time to work on it. Overall, I would definitely recommend her to anyone taking this class

Amazing Professor! She is sweet and caring, her assignments are fairly easy. We had small assignments and like 2 quizzes based on a reading but they were super easy as long as you read. Most of our grade was made up of the performance responses and instead of a final, we had a project, which wasn't hard because she broke it down over a few weeks.
